orog.comment: height above the geoid; as defined here, ""the geoid"" is a surface of constant geopotential that, if the ocean were at rest, would coincide with mean sea level. Under this definition, the geoid changes as the mean volume of the ocean changes (e.g., due to glacial melt, or global warming of the ocean).  Report here the height above the present-day geoid.  Over ocean, report as 0.0

p0.long_name: vertical coordinate formula term: reference pressure

mrsos.long_name: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column

mrso.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where land
mrso.comment: the mass per unit area  (summed over all soil layers) of water in all phases.

mrfso.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where land
mrfso.comment: the mass (summed over all all layers) of frozen water.

mrros.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where land
mrros.comment: the total surface runoff leaving the land portion of the grid cell.

mrro.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where land
mrro.comment: "the total runoff (including ""drainage"" through the base of the soil model) leaving the land portion of the grid cell."

prveg.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where land
prveg.comment: the precipitation flux that is intercepted by the vegetation canopy (if present in model) before reaching the ground.

evspsblveg.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where land
evspsblveg.comment: the canopy evaporation+sublimation (if present in model).

evspsblsoi.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where land

tran.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where land

mrlsl.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where land
mrlsl.comment: in each soil layer, the mass of water in all phases, including ice.  Reported as ""missing"" for grid cells occupied entirely by ""sea""

tsl.comment: "Temperature of each soil layer.  Reported as ""missing"" for grid cells occupied entirely by ""sea""."

treeFrac.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by trees.

grassFrac.comment: fraction of entire grid cell that is covered by natural grass.

shrubFrac.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by shrub.

cropFrac.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by crop.

pastureFrac.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by anthropogenic pasture.

baresoilFrac.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by bare soil.

residualFrac.long_name: Fraction of Grid Cell that is Land but Neither Vegetation-Covered nor Bare Soil
residualFrac.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is land and is covered by ""non-vegetation"" and ""non-bare-soil"" (e.g., urban, ice, lakes, etc.)

burntArea.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by burnt vegetation.

fFire.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where land
fFire.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to CO2 Emission from Fire
fFire.comment: CO2 emissions (expressed as a carbon mass flux) from natural fires + human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the DGVM, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc, defined below (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change).

fGrazing.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where land

fLuc.comment: human changes to land (excluding forest regrowth) accounting possibly for different time-scales related to fate of the wood, for example.

nbp.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where land
nbp.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Biospheric Production on Land
nbp.comment: This is the net mass flux of carbon between land and atmosphere calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of  plant and soil respiration, carbonfluxes  from fire, harvest, grazing  and land use change. Positive flux  is into the land.

fVegSoil.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil
fVegSoil.comment: In some models part of carbon (e.g., root exudate) can go directly into the soil pool without entering litter.

cSoilSlow.comment: fast is meant as lifetime of more than 100 years for  reference climate conditions (20 C, no water limitations)

landCoverFrac.comment: The categories may differ from model to model, depending on their  PFT definitions.   This may include natural PFTs, anthropogenic PFTs, bare soil, lakes, urban areas, etc.   Sum of all should equal the fraction of the grid-cell that is land.

treeFracPrimDec.comment: "This is the fraction of the entire grid cell  that is covered by ""total primary deciduous trees."""

treeFracPrimEver.long_name: Total Primary Evergreen Tree Cover Fraction
treeFracPrimEver.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by primary evergreen trees.

treeFracSecDec.long_name: Total Secondary Deciduous Tree Cover Fraction
treeFracSecDec.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by secondary deciduous trees.

treeFracSecEver.long_name: Total Secondary Evergreen Tree Cover Fraction
treeFracSecEver.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by secondary evergreen trees.

c3PftFrac.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by C3 PFTs (including grass, crops, and trees).

c4PftFrac.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by C4 PFTs (including grass and crops).

nppWood.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where land

tnhusmp.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity due to Model Physics
tnhusmp.comment: This includes sources and sinks from parametrized physics (e.g. convection, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.) and excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics and diffusion.

clwc.long_name: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Liquid Water
clwc.comment: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clic.long_name: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Ice
clic.comment: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clws.long_name: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water
clws.comment: Calculated as the mass of stratiform cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clis.long_name: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice
clis.comment: Calculated as the mass of stratiform cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

mcu.comment: Calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

mcd.comment: Calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

smc.comment: The net mass flux represents the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  For models with a distinct shallow convection scheme, this is calculated as convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

dmc.comment: The net mass flux  represents the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.   This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

pr.comment: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.  This is the 3-hour mean precipitation flux.

mrsos.cell_methods: time: point area: mean where land
mrsos.long_name: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column
mrsos.comment: the mass of water in all phases in a thin surface soil layer.

tslsi.long_name: Surface Temperature Where Land or Sea Ice
tslsi.comment: ""skin"" temperature of all surfaces except open ocean, sampled synoptically.

tso.cell_methods: time: point area: mean where sea
tso.comment: temperature of surface of open ocean, sampled synoptically.

prc.comment: at surface.  This is a 3-hour mean convective precipitation flux.

prsn.comment: at surface.  Includes precipitation of all forms water in the solid phase.  This is the 3-hour mean snowfall flux.

mrro.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where land
mrro.comment: the total runoff (including ""drainage"" through the base of the soil model) leaving the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell, averaged over the 3-hour interval.

ps.comment: sampled synoptically to diagnose atmospheric tides, this is better than mean sea level pressure.

clt.comment: for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Include both large-scale and convective cloud.  This is a 3-hour mean.

a.long_name: vertical coordinate formula term: coefficient a

b.long_name: vertical coordinate formula term: coefficient b

orog.comment: height above the geoid; as defined here, ""the geoid"" is a surface of constant geopotential that, if the ocean were at rest, would coincide with mean sea level. Under this definition, the geoid changes as the mean volume of the ocean changes (e.g., due to glacial melt, or global warming of the ocean).  Reported here is the height above the present-day geoid (0.0 over ocean).

sftgif.long_name: Fraction of Grid Cell Covered with Glacier
sftgif.comment: fraction of grid cell occupied by ""permanent"" ice (i.e., glaciers).

mrsofc.long_name: Capacity of Soil to Store Water
mrsofc.comment: "reported ""where land"": divide the total water holding capacity of all the soil in the grid cell by the land area in the grid cell;  reported as ""missing"" where the land fraction is 0."

rootd.comment: report the maximum soil depth reachable by plant roots (if defined in model), i.e., the maximum soil depth from which they can extract moisture; report as ""missing"" where the land fraction is 0.

deptho.comment: Ocean bathymetry.   Reported here is the sea floor depth for present day. Reported as missing for land grid cells.

sftof.comment: This is the area fraction at the ocean surface.

basin.flag_meanings: global_land southern_ocean atlantic_ocean pacific_ocean arctic_ocean indian_ocean mediterranean_sea black_sea hudson_bay baltic_sea red_sea

hfgeou.long_name: Upward Geothermal Heat Flux at Sea Floor

orog.comment: height above the geoid; as defined here, ""the geoid"" is a surface of constant geopotential that, if the ocean were at rest, would coincide with mean sea level. Under this definition, the geoid changes as the mean volume of the ocean changes (e.g., due to glacial melt, or global warming of the ocean).  Report here the height above the present-day geoid.  Over ocean, report as 0.0

p0.long_name: vertical coordinate formula term: reference pressure

cfadDbze94.comment: CFADs (Cloud Frequency Altitude Diagrams) are joint height - radar reflectivity (or lidar scattering ratio) distributions.

cfadLidarsr532.comment: CFADs (Cloud Frequency Altitude Diagrams) are joint height - radar reflectivity (or lidar scattering ratio) distributions.

parasolRefl.comment: Simulated reflectance from PARASOL as seen at the top of the atmosphere for 5 solar zenith angles. Valid only over ocean and for one viewing direction (viewing zenith angle of 30 degrees and relative azimuth angle 320 degrees).

toffset.comment: "this ""offset time"" should be added to the value stored in the ""time dimension"" to get the actual time.  This actual time is the time (UTC) of the corresponding point in the satellite orbit used to extract the model data."

psl.comment: not, in general, the same as surface pressure

ps.comment: not, in general, the same as mean sea-level pressure

sfcWind.comment: This is the mean of the speed, not the speed computed from the mean u and v components of wind

hurs.comment: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

pr.comment: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases from all types of clouds (both large-scale and convective)

prsn.comment: at surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase

prc.comment: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.

evspsbl.comment: at surface; flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

sbl.long_name: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
sbl.comment: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass from the surface resulting from their conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere.

rsdt.comment: at the top of the atmosphere

rsut.comment: at the top of the atmosphere

rlut.comment: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)

prw.comment: vertically integrated through the atmospheric column

clt.comment: for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Include both large-scale and convective cloud.

clwvi.comment: mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clivi.comment: mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

rtmt.long_name: Net Downward Flux at Top of Model
rtmt.comment: i.e., at the top of that portion of the atmosphere where dynamics are explicitly treated by the model. This is reported only if it differs from the net downward radiative flux at the top of the atmosphere.

ccb.long_name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base

cct.long_name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top

ci.comment: Fraction of time that convection occurs in the grid cell .

sci.long_name: Fraction of Time Shallow Convection Occurs
sci.comment: Fraction of time that shallow convection occurs in the grid cell.

fco2antt.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to All Anthropogenic Emissions of CO2
fco2antt.comment: This is requested only for the emission-driven coupled carbon climate model runs.  Does not include natural fire sources but, includes all anthropogenic sources, including fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning, and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change excluding forest regrowth.

fco2fos.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Fossil Fuel Emissions of CO2
fco2fos.comment: This is the prescribed anthropogenic CO2 flux from fossil fuel use, including cement production, and flaring (but not from land-use changes, agricultural burning, forest regrowth, etc.)

fco2nat.long_name: Surface Carbon Mass Flux into the Atmosphere Due to Natural Sources
fco2nat.comment: This is what the atmosphere sees (on its own grid).  This field should be equivalent to the combined natural fluxes of carbon (requested in the L_mon and O_mon tables) that account for natural exchanges between the atmosphere and land or ocean reservoirs (i.e., ""net ecosystem biospheric productivity"", for land, and ""air to sea CO2 flux"", for ocean.)

cltc.comment: for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes only convective cloud.

zfull.comment: This is actual height above mean sea level, not geopotential height

zhalf.comment: This is actual height above mean sea level, not geopotential height.  This is actual height above mean sea level, not geopotential height.  Includes both the top of the model atmosphere and surface levels.

clws.long_name: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water
clws.comment: Calculated as the mass of stratiform cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clis.long_name: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice
clis.comment: Calculate as the mass of stratiform cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  Include precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clwc.long_name: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Liquid Water
clwc.comment: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clic.long_name: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Ice
clic.comment: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

reffclws.long_name: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water
reffclws.comment: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

reffclis.long_name: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Stratiform Cloud Ice
reffclis.comment: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

reffclwc.long_name: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Convective Cloud Liquid Water
reffclwc.comment: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

reffclic.long_name: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Convective Cloud Ice
reffclic.comment: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

prsnc.comment: convective precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase.

prlsns.comment: large-scale precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase.

reffgrpls.long_name: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Stratiform Graupel
reffgrpls.comment: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

reffrainc.long_name: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Convective Rainfall
reffrainc.comment: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

reffrains.long_name: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Stratiform Rainfall
reffrains.comment: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

reffsnowc.long_name: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Convective Snowfall
reffsnowc.comment: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

reffsnows.long_name: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Stratiform Snowfall
reffsnows.comment: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

dtaus.comment: This is the in-cloud optical depth obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell.

dtauc.comment: This is the in-cloud optical depth obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell

dems.comment: This is the in-cloud emissivity obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell.

demc.comment: This is the in-cloud emissivity obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell.

longitude.valid_min: 0.           ! CMOR will add n*360 to input values

vertices_longitude.valid_min: 0.           ! CMOR will add n*360 to input values

orog.comment: height above the geoid; as defined here, ""the geoid"" is a surface of constant geopotential that, if the ocean were at rest, would coincide with mean sea level. Under this definition, the geoid changes as the mean volume of the ocean changes (e.g., due to glacial melt, or global warming of the ocean).  Report here the height above the present-day geoid.  Over ocean, report as 0.0

p0.long_name: vertical coordinate formula term: reference pressure

psl.comment: not, in general, the same as surface pressure

ps.comment: not, in general, the same as mean sea-level pressure

sfcWind.comment: This is the mean of the speed, not the speed computed from the mean u and v components of wind

hurs.comment: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

pr.comment: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases from all types of clouds (both large-scale and convective)

prsn.comment: at surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase

prc.comment: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.

evspsbl.comment: at surface; flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

sbl.long_name: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
sbl.comment: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass from the surface resulting from their conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere.

rsdt.comment: at the top of the atmosphere

rsut.comment: at the top of the atmosphere

rlut.comment: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)

prw.comment: vertically integrated through the atmospheric column

clt.comment: for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Include both large-scale and convective cloud.

clwvi.comment: mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clivi.comment: mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

rtmt.long_name: Net Downward Flux at Top of Model
rtmt.comment: i.e., at the top of that portion of the atmosphere where dynamics are explicitly treated by the model. This is reported only if it differs from the net downward radiative flux at the top of the atmosphere.

ccb.long_name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base

cct.long_name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top

ci.comment: Fraction of time that convection occurs in the grid cell .

sci.long_name: Fraction of Time Shallow Convection Occurs
sci.comment: Fraction of time that shallow convection occurs in the grid cell.

fco2antt.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to All Anthropogenic Emissions of CO2
fco2antt.comment: This is requested only for the emission-driven coupled carbon climate model runs.  Does not include natural fire sources but, includes all anthropogenic sources, including fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning, and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change excluding forest regrowth.

fco2fos.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Fossil Fuel Emissions of CO2
fco2fos.comment: This is the prescribed anthropogenic CO2 flux from fossil fuel use, including cement production, and flaring (but not from land-use changes, agricultural burning, forest regrowth, etc.)

fco2nat.long_name: Surface Carbon Mass Flux into the Atmosphere Due to Natural Sources
fco2nat.comment: This is what the atmosphere sees (on its own grid).  This field should be equivalent to the combined natural fluxes of carbon (requested in the L_mon and O_mon tables) that account for natural exchanges between the atmosphere and land or ocean reservoirs (i.e., ""net ecosystem biospheric productivity"", for land, and ""air to sea CO2 flux"", for ocean.)

cl.comment: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

clw.long_name: Mass Fraction of Cloud Liquid Water
clw.comment: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.  This is the mass of  cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

cli.comment: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud. This is the mass of  cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

mc.comment: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the updrafts).

hur.comment: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

wap.comment: commonly referred to as ""omega"", this represents the vertical component of velocity in pressure coordinates (positive down)

tntmp.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Diabatic Processes

tntc.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Moist Convection

evu.long_name: Eddy Viscosity Coefficient for Momentum Variables

edt.long_name: Eddy Diffusivity Coefficient for Temperature Variable

sic.comment: fraction of grid cell covered by sea ice.

sit.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
sit.comment: the mean thickness of sea ice in the ocean portion of the grid cell (averaging over the entire ocean portion, including the ice-free fraction).  Reported as 0.0 in regions free of sea ice.

sim.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
sim.long_name: Sea Ice Plus Surface Snow Amount
sim.comment: the  mass per unit area of sea ice plus snow in the ocean portion of the grid cell (averaging over the entire ocean portion, including the ice-free fraction).  Reported as 0.0 in regions free of sea ice.

evap.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea_ice over sea
evap.long_name: Water Evaporation Flux from Sea Ice
evap.comment: the average rate that water mass evaporates (or sublimates) from the sea ice surface (i.e., kg/s) divided by the area of the ocean (i.e., open ocean + sea ice) portion of the grid cell. This quantity, multiplied both by the oean area of the grid cell and by the length of the month, should yield the total mass of water evaporated (or sublimated) from the sea ice.  Reported as 0.0 in regions free of sea ice.  [This was computed differently in CMIP3.]

snd.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
snd.comment: the mean thickness of snow in the ocean portion of the grid cell (averaging over the entire ocean portion, including the snow-free ocean fraction).  Reported as 0.0 in regions free of snow-covered sea ice.

snc.comment: Fraction of entire grid cell covered by snow that lies on sea ice; exclude snow that lies on land or land ice.

ialb.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea_ice
ialb.comment: "Reported as ""missing"" if there is no sunlight or if a region is free of sea ice. "

ssi.cell_methods: time: mean (weighted by mass of sea ice)
ssi.comment: When computing the time-mean here, the time-samples, weighted by the mass of sea ice in the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.  Reported as ""missing"" in regions free of sea ice.

tsice.cell_methods: time: mean (weighted by area of sea ice)
tsice.comment: When computing the time-mean here, the time-samples, weighted by the area of sea ice in the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.  Reported as ""missing"" in regions free of sea ice.  Note this will be the surface snow temperature in regions where snow covers the sea ice.

tsnint.cell_methods: time: mean (weighted by area of snow-covered sea ice)
tsnint.long_name: Temperature at Interface Between Sea Ice and Snow
tsnint.comment: When computing the time-mean here, the time-samples, weighted by the area of snow-covered sea ice in the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.  Reported as ""missing"" in regions free of snow-covered sea ice.

pr.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea_ice over sea
pr.long_name: Surface Rainfall Rate into the Sea Ice Portion of the Grid Cell
pr.comment: where sea ice over sea: this is the the water mass per unit time falling as rain onto the sea ice portion of a grid cell divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell (including both ice-free and sea-ice covered fractions).  Reported as 0. in regions free of sea ice.

prsn.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea_ice over sea
prsn.long_name: Surface Snowfall Rate into the Sea Ice Portion of the Grid Cell
prsn.comment: where sea ice over sea: this is computed as the total mass per unit time of solid-phase precipitation falling onto the sea ice portion of a grid cell divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell (including both ice-free and sea-ice covered fractions).  Reported as 0. in regions free of sea ice. (Snowfall flux includes all types of solid-phase precipitation.)

ageice.cell_methods: time: mean (weighted b mass of sea ice)
ageice.comment: When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the mass of sea ice in the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.  Reported as ""missing"" in regions free of sea ice.

grFrazil.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
grFrazil.comment: the rate of change of sea ice mass due to frazil sea ice formation divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.  Reported as 0.0 in regions free of sea ice.

grCongel.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
grCongel.comment: the rate of change of sea ice mass due to congelation sea ice divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.  Reported as 0.0 in regions free of sea ice.

grLateral.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
grLateral.comment: the rate of change of sea ice mass due to lateral growth alone of the sea ice divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.  Reported as 0.0 in regions free of sea ice.

snoToIce.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
snoToIce.comment: the rate of change of sea ice mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice, divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.  Reported as 0.0 in regions free of snow-covered sea ice.

snomelt.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
snomelt.comment: the rate of change of snow mass  due to melting, divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.  Reported as 0.0 in regions free of sea ice.  Includes falling snow that melts on impact with the surface.

tmelt.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
tmelt.long_name: Rate of Melt at Upper Surface of Sea Ice
tmelt.comment: the rate of change of sea ice mass due to melting at its upper surface, divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.  Reported as 0.0 in regions free of sea ice. Does not include rate of change of snow mass.

bmelt.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
bmelt.long_name: Rate of Melt at Sea Ice Base
bmelt.comment: the rate of change of sea ice mass due to melting at its lower surface, divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.  Reported as 0.0 in regions free of sea ice.

hcice.cell_methods: time: mean (weighted by mass of sea ice)
hcice.comment: Ice at 0 Celsius is assumed taken to have a heat content of 0 J.  When averaging over time, this quantity is weighted by the mass of sea ice.   Reported as ""missing in regions free of sea ice.  Does not include heat content of snow.

rsdssi.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea_ice over sea
rsdssi.comment: the downwelling shortwave flux in regions of sea ice divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

rsussi.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea_ice over sea
rsussi.comment: the upward shortwave flux in regions of sea ice divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

rldssi.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea_ice over sea
rldssi.long_name: Downwelling Long Wave over Sea Ice
rldssi.comment: the downwelling longwave flux in regions of sea ice divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

rlussi.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea_ice over sea
rlussi.long_name: Upward Long Wave over Sea Ice
rlussi.comment: the upward longwave flux in regions of sea ice divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

hfssi.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea_ice over sea
hfssi.long_name: Surface Upward Sensible Heat Flux over Sea Ice
hfssi.comment: the upward sensible heat flux in regions of sea ice divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

hflssi.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea_ice over sea
hflssi.long_name: Surface Upward Latent Heat Flux over Sea Ice
hflssi.comment: the upward latent heat flux in regions of sea ice divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

sblsi.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea_ice over sea
sblsi.comment: the upward flux of water vapor to the atmosphere due to sublimation of snow and sea  ice in regions of sea ice divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

transix.long_name: X-Component of Sea Ice Mass Transport
transix.comment: The sea ice mass transport is 0.0 in ice-free regions of the ocean.  Snow is included in calculation of mass.

transiy.long_name: Y-Component of Sea Ice Mass Transport
transiy.comment: The sea ice mass transport is 0.0 in ice-free regions of the ocean.  Snow is included in calculation of mass.

transifs.long_name: Sea Ice Mass Transport Through Fram Strait

strairx.cell_methods: time: mean (weighted by area of sea ice)
strairx.long_name: X-Component of Atmospheric Stress On Sea Ice
strairx.comment: When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the area of sea ice, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Reported as ""missing"" in regions free of sea ice.

strairy.cell_methods: time: mean (weighted by area of sea ice)
strairy.long_name: Y-Component of Atmospheric Stress On Sea Ice
strairy.comment: When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the area of sea ice, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Reported as ""missing"" in regions free of sea ice.

strocnx.cell_methods: time: mean (weighted by area of sea ice)
strocnx.long_name: X-Component of Ocean Stress On Sea Ice
strocnx.comment: When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the area of sea ice, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Report as ""missing"" in regions free of sea ice.

strocny.cell_methods: time: mean (weighted by area of sea ice)
strocny.long_name: Y-Component of Ocean Stress On Sea Ice
strocny.comment: When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the area of sea ice, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Reported as ""missing"" in regions free of sea ice.

streng.cell_methods: time: mean (weighted by area of sea ice)
streng.comment: When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the area of sea ice, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Reported as ""missing"" in regions free of sea ice.

divice.cell_methods: time: mean (weighted by area of sea ice)
divice.long_name: Strain Rate Divergence of Sea Ice
divice.comment: When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the area of sea ice, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Reported as ""missing"" in regions free of sea ice.

eshrice.cell_methods: time: mean (weighted by area of sea ice)
eshrice.long_name: Eastward Derivative of Northward Sea Ice Velocity
eshrice.comment: When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the area of sea ice, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Reported as ""missing"" in regions free of sea ice.

nshrice.cell_methods: time: mean (weighted by area of sea ice)
nshrice.long_name: Northward Derivative of Eastward Sea Ice Velocity
nshrice.comment: When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the area of sea ice, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Reported as ""missing"" in regions free of sea ice.

orog.comment: height above the geoid; as defined here, ""the geoid"" is a surface of constant geopotential that, if the ocean were at rest, would coincide with mean sea level. Under this definition, the geoid changes as the mean volume of the ocean changes (e.g., due to glacial melt, or global warming of the ocean).  Report here the height above the present-day geoid.  Over ocean, report as 0.0

p0.long_name: vertical coordinate formula term: reference pressure

ps.comment: not, in general, the same as mean sea-level pressure

od550aer.long_name: Ambient Aerosol Optical Thickness at 550 nm
od550aer.comment: AOD from the ambient aerosls (i.e., includes aerosol water).  Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types.

od550lt1aer.long_name: Ambient Fine Aerosol Optical Thickness at 550 nm
od550lt1aer.comment: od550 due to particles with wet diameter less than 1 um  (""ambient"" means ""wetted""). When models do not include explicit size information, it can be assumed that all anthropogenic aerosols and natural secondary aerosols have diameter less than 1 um.

abs550aer.long_name: Ambient Aerosol Absorption Optical Thickness at 550 nm

od870aer.long_name: Ambient Aerosol Optical Thickness at 870 nm
od870aer.comment: AOD from the ambient aerosls (i.e., includes aerosol water).  Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types.

emioa.long_name: Rate of Emission and Production of Dry Aerosol Total Organic Matter
emioa.comment: tendency of atmosphere mass content of organic matter dry aerosol due to net production and emission.  This is the sum of total emission of POA and total production of SOA (see next two entries). ""Mass"" refers to the mass of organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone.

emipoa.long_name: Emission Rate of Dry Aerosol Primary Organic Matter
emipoa.comment: tendency of atmosphere mass content of primary organic aerosol due to emission:  ""mass"" refers to the mass of primary organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone.

chepsoa.long_name: Production Rate of Dry Aerosol Secondary Organic Matter
chepsoa.comment: tendency of atmosphere mass content of secondary organic matter_dry aerosol due to net production:  If model lumps SOA emissions with POA, then the sum of POA and SOA emissions is reported as POA emissions.  ""mass"" refers to the mass of primary organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone.

emibc.long_name: Emission Rate of Black Carbon Aerosol Mass

dryoa.long_name: Dry Deposition Rate of Dry Aerosol Organic Matter
dryoa.comment: tendency of atmosphere mass content of organic dry aerosol due to dry deposition: This is the sum of dry deposition of POA and dry deposition of SOA (see next two entries). ""Mass"" refers to the mass of organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone.

drypoa.long_name: Dry Deposition Rate of Dry Aerosol Primary Organic Matter

drysoa.long_name: Dry Deposition Rate of Dry Aerosol Secondary Organic Matter

drybc.long_name: Dry Deposition Rate of Black Carbon Aerosol Mass

wetoa.long_name: Wet Deposition Rate of Dry Aerosol Organic Matter
wetoa.comment: tendency of atmosphere mass content of organic matter dry aerosols due to wet deposition: This is the sum of wet deposition of POA and wet deposition of SOA (see next two entries). ""Mass"" refers to the mass of organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone.

wetpoa.long_name: Wet Deposition Rate of Dry Aerosol Primary Organic Matter

wetsoa.long_name: Wet Deposition Rate of Dry Aerosol Secondary Organic Matter

wetbc.long_name: Wet Deposition Rate of Black Carbon Aerosol Mass

emibb.long_name: Total Emission of Primary Aerosol from Biomass Burning
emibb.comment: tendency of atmosphere mass content of primary organic matter dry aerosol due to emission: This does not include sources of secondary aerosols from biomass burning aerosols, such as SO2 or SOA.

emiso4.long_name: Total Direct Emission Rate of SO4
emiso4.comment: expressed as a tendency of atmosphere mass content of SO4.  Direct emission does not include secondary sulfate production.

loadoa.long_name: Load of Dry Aerosol Organic Matter
loadoa.comment: atmosphere dry organic content: This is the vertically integrated sum of atmosphere_primary_organic_content and atmosphere_secondary_organic_content (see next two table entries).

loadpoa.long_name: Load of Dry Aerosol Primary Organic Matter

loadsoa.long_name: Load of Dry Aerosol Secondary Organic Matter

sconcoa.long_name: Surface Concentration of Dry Aerosol Organic Matter
sconcoa.comment: mass concentration of particulate organic matter dry aerosol in air in model lowest layer

sconcpoa.long_name: Surface Concentration of Dry Aerosol Primary Organic Matter
sconcpoa.comment: mass concentration of primary particulate organic matter dry aerosol in air in model lowest layer

sconcsoa.long_name: Surface Concentration of Dry Aerosol Secondary Organic Matter
sconcsoa.comment: mass concentration of secondary particulate organic matter dry aerosol in air in model lowest layer.  If the model lumps SOA with POA, then their sum is reported as POA.

sconcbc.long_name: Surface Concentration of Black Carbon Aerosol
sconcbc.comment: mass concentration of black carbon dry aerosol in air in model lowest layer

sconcso4.comment: mass concentration of sulfate dry aerosol in air in model lowest layer.

sconcdust.comment: mass concentration of dust dry aerosol in air in model lowest layer

sconcss.comment: mass concentration of seasalt dry aerosol in air in model lowest layer

sconcno3.comment: Mass concentration in model lowest layer

sconcnh4.comment: Mass concentration in model lowest layer

rsdscsdiff.long_name: Surface Diffuse Downwelling Clear Sky Shortwave Radiation

reffclwtop.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  This is the effective radius ""as seen from space"" over liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.

cldncl.long_name: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Cloud Tops
cldncl.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  Report concentration ""as seen from space"" over liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.

cldnci.long_name: Ice Crystal Number Concentration of Cloud Tops
cldnci.comment: concentration ""as seen from space"" over ice-cloud portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with ice cloud or, if available, it is the sum over all ice cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total ice cloud top fraction (as seen from TOA) of each time sample when computing monthly mean.

cldnvi.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  Values are weighted by liquid cloud fraction in each layer when vertically integrating, and for monthly means the samples are weighted by total liquid cloud fraction (as seen from TOA).

concoa.long_name: Concentration of Dry Aerosol Organic Matter

concpoa.long_name: Concentration of Dry Aerosol Primary Organic Matter

concsoa.long_name: Concentration of Dry Aerosol Secondary Organic Matter

concnmcn.long_name: Number Concentration of Nucleation Mode Aerosol
concnmcn.comment: includes all particles with diameter smaller than 3 nm

conccmcn.comment: includes all particles with diameter larger than 1 micron

reffclws.comment: Droplets are liquid.  The effective radius is defined as the ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution and the time-mean should be calculated, weighting the individual samples by the cloudy fraction of the grid cell.

reffclwc.comment: Droplets are liquid.  The effective radius is defined as the ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution and the time-mean should be calculated, weighting the individual samples by the cloudy fraction of the grid cell.

cdnc.comment: Cloud droplet number concentration in liquid clouds

snc.comment: Fraction of each grid cell that is occupied by snow that rests on land portion of cell.

snw.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where land
snw.comment: Computed as the mass of surface snow on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as 0.0 where the land fraction is 0; excluded is snow on vegetation canopy or on sea ice.

snd.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where land
snd.comment: where land over land, this is computed as the mean thickness of snow in the land portion of the grid cell (averaging over the entire land portion, including the snow-free fraction).  Reported as 0.0 where the land fraction is 0.

lwsnl.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where land
lwsnl.long_name: Liquid Water Content of Snow Layer
lwsnl.comment: where land over land: this is computed as the total mass of liquid water contained interstitially within the snow layer of the land portion of a grid cell divided by the area of the land portion of the cell.

sootsn.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where land
sootsn.comment: the entire land portion of the grid cell is considered, with snow soot content set to 0.0 in regions free of snow.

agesno.cell_methods: time: mean (with samples weighted by snow mass) area: mean where land
agesno.comment: When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the mass of snow on the land portion of the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.  Reported as ""missing in regions free of snow on land.

tsn.cell_methods: time: mean (with samples weighted by snow mass) area: mean where land
tsn.comment: This temperature is averaged over all the snow in the grid cell that rests on land or land ice.  When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the mass of snow on the land portion of the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Reported as ""missing in regions free of snow on land.

snm.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where land
snm.comment: Computed as the total surface melt water on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; report as 0.0 for snow-free land regions; report as 0.0 where the land fraction is 0.

sbl.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where land
sbl.long_name: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
sbl.comment: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass resulting from their conversion to water vapor.  Computed as the total sublimation on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as 0.0 for snow-free land regions; reported as 0.0 where the land fraction is 0.

hfdsn.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where land
hfdsn.long_name: Downward Heat Flux into Snow Where Land over Land
hfdsn.comment: the net downward heat flux from the atmosphere into the snow that lies on land divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as 0.0 for snow-free land regions or where the land fraction is 0.

tpf.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where land
tpf.comment: where land over land: This is the mean thickness of the permafrost layer in the land portion of the grid cell.  Reported as 0.0 in permafrost-free regions.

cfadDbze94.comment: CFADs (Cloud Frequency Altitude Diagrams) are joint height - radar reflectivity (or lidar scattering ratio) distributions  .

cfadLidarsr532.comment: CFADs (Cloud Frequency Altitude Diagrams) are joint height - radar reflectivity (or lidar scattering ratio) distributions.

parasolRefl.comment: Simulated reflectance from PARASOL as seen at the top of the atmosphere for 5 solar zenith angles. Valid only over ocean and for one viewing direction (viewing zenith angle of 30 degrees and relative azimuth angle 320 degrees).

a.long_name: vertical coordinate formula term: coefficient a

b.long_name: vertical coordinate formula term: coefficient b

bddtdic.comment: Net of biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic carbon

bddtdin.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea

zfull.long_name: Depth Below Geoid of Ocean Layer

orog.comment: height above the geoid; as defined here, ""the geoid"" is a surface of constant geopotential that, if the ocean were at rest, would coincide with mean sea level. Under this definition, the geoid changes as the mean volume of the ocean changes (e.g., due to glacial melt, or global warming of the ocean).  Report here the height above the present-day geoid.  Over ocean, report as 0.0

p0.long_name: vertical coordinate formula term: reference pressure

tasmin.cell_methods: time: minimum within days time: mean over days
tasmin.comment: monthly mean of the daily-minimum near-surface air temperature.

tasmax.cell_methods: time: maximum within days time: mean over days
tasmax.comment: monthly mean of the daily-maximum near-surface air temperature.

psl.comment: not, in general, the same as surface pressure

ps.comment: not, in general, the same as mean sea-level pressure

sfcWind.comment: This is the mean of the speed, not the speed computed from the mean u and v components of wind

hurs.comment: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

pr.comment: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases from all types of clouds (both large-scale and convective)

prsn.comment: at surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase

prc.comment: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.

evspsbl.comment: at surface; flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

sbl.long_name: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
sbl.comment: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass from the surface resulting from their conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere.

rsdt.comment: at the top of the atmosphere

rsut.comment: at the top of the atmosphere

rlut.comment: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)

prw.comment: vertically integrated through the atmospheric column

clt.comment: for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Include both large-scale and convective cloud.

clwvi.comment: mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clivi.comment: mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

rtmt.long_name: Net Downward Flux at Top of Model
rtmt.comment: i.e., at the top of that portion of the atmosphere where dynamics are explicitly treated by the model. This is reported only if it differs from the net downward radiative flux at the top of the atmosphere.

ccb.long_name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base

cct.long_name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top

ci.comment: Fraction of time that convection occurs in the grid cell .

sci.long_name: Fraction of Time Shallow Convection Occurs
sci.comment: Fraction of time that shallow convection occurs in the grid cell.

fco2antt.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to All Anthropogenic Emissions of CO2
fco2antt.comment: This is requested only for the emission-driven coupled carbon climate model runs.  Does not include natural fire sources but, includes all anthropogenic sources, including fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning, and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change excluding forest regrowth.

fco2fos.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Fossil Fuel Emissions of CO2
fco2fos.comment: This is the prescribed anthropogenic CO2 flux from fossil fuel use, including cement production, and flaring (but not from land-use changes, agricultural burning, forest regrowth, etc.)

fco2nat.long_name: Surface Carbon Mass Flux into the Atmosphere Due to Natural Sources
fco2nat.comment: This is what the atmosphere sees (on its own grid).  This field should be equivalent to the combined natural fluxes of carbon (requested in the L_mon and O_mon tables) that account for natural exchanges between the atmosphere and land or ocean reservoirs (i.e., ""net ecosystem biospheric productivity"", for land, and ""air to sea CO2 flux"", for ocean.)

cl.comment: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

clw.long_name: Mass Fraction of Cloud Liquid Water
clw.comment: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.  Calculate as the mass of cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cells. Precipitating hydrometeors are included ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

cli.comment: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.  This is calculated as the mass of cloud ice in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell. It includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

mc.comment: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  The flux is computed as the mass divided by the area of the grid cell.

hur.comment: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

wap.comment: commonly referred to as ""omega"", this represents the vertical component of velocity in pressure coordinates (positive down)

dfe.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
dfe.comment: dissolved iron in sea water is meant to include both Fe2+ and Fe3+ ions (but not, e.g., particulate detrital iron)

si.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea

chl.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
chl.long_name: Total Chlorophyll Mass Concentration at Surface
chl.comment: sum of chlorophyll from all phytoplankton group concentrations.  In most models this is equal to chldiat+chlmisc, that is the sum of ""Diatom Chlorophyll Mass Concentration"" plus ""Other Phytoplankton Chlorophyll Mass Concentration""

chldiat.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
chldiat.long_name: Diatom Chlorophyll Mass Concentration at Surface
chldiat.comment: chlorophyll from diatom phytoplankton component concentration alone

chldiaz.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
chldiaz.long_name: Mass Concentration of Diazotrophs expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water at Surface
chldiaz.comment: chlorophyll concentration from the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone

chlcalc.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
chlcalc.long_name: Mass Concentration of Calcareous Phytoplankton expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water at Surface
chlcalc.comment: chlorophyll concentration from the calcite-producing phytoplankton component alone

chlpico.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
chlpico.long_name: Mass Concentration of Picophytoplankton expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water at Surface
chlpico.comment: chlorophyll concentration from the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone

chlmisc.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
chlmisc.long_name: Other Phytoplankton Chlorophyll Mass Concentration at Surface
chlmisc.comment: chlorophyll from additional phytoplankton component concentrations alone

pon.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
pon.long_name: Particulate Organic Nitrogen Concentration at Surface
pon.comment: sum of particulate organic nitrogen component concentrations

pop.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
pop.long_name: Particulate Organic Phosphorus Concentration at Surface
pop.comment: sum of particulate organic phosphorus component concentrations

bfe.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea

bfe.comment: sum of particulate organic iron component concentrations

bsi.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
bsi.long_name: Particulate Biogenic Silica Concentration at Surface
bsi.comment: sum of particulate silica component concentrations

phyn.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
phyn.comment: sum of phytoplankton nitrogen component concentrations

phyfe.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
phyfe.comment: sum of phytoplankton iron component concentrations

physi.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
physi.comment: sum of phytoplankton silica component concentrations

intpp.comment: Vertically integrated total primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton.  This should equal the sum of intpdiat+intpphymisc, but those individual components may be unavailable in some models.

intpmisc.comment: Vertically integrated total primary (organic carbon) production by other phytoplankton components alone

fbddtdic.comment: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic carbon

fbddtdin.long_name: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Nitrogen due to Biological Activity
fbddtdin.comment: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of nitrogen nutrients (e.g. NO3+NH4)

fbddtdip.long_name: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Phosphate due to Biological Activity
fbddtdip.comment: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of phosphate

fbddtdife.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
fbddtdife.long_name: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Iron due to Biological Activity
fbddtdife.comment: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic iron

fbddtdisi.long_name: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Silicate due to Biological Activity
fbddtdisi.comment: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic silicate

fbddtalk.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
fbddtalk.long_name: Rate of Change of Biological Alkalinity due to Biological Activity
fbddtalk.comment: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of alkalinity

omldamax.long_name: Mean Daily Maximum Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Mixing Scheme

pr.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea
pr.long_name: Rainfall Flux where Ice Free Ocean over Sea
pr.comment: computed as the total mass of liquid water falling as liquid rain  into the ice-free portion of the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

prsn.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea
prsn.long_name: Snowfall Flux where Ice Free Ocean over Sea
prsn.comment: computed as the total mass per unit time of solid-phase precipitation falling into the ice-free portion of the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.   (Snowfall flux includes all types of solid-phase precipitation.)

evs.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea
evs.long_name: Water Evaporation Flux Where Ice Free Ocean over Sea
evs.comment: computed as the total mass of water vapor evaporating from the ice-free portion of the ocean  divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

friver.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
friver.long_name: Water Flux into Sea Water From Rivers
friver.comment: computed as the river flux of water into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

ficeberg.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
ficeberg.long_name: Water Flux into Sea Water From Icebergs
ficeberg.comment: computed as the iceberg melt water  flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

ficeberg2d.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
ficeberg2d.long_name: Water Flux into Sea Water From Icebergs
ficeberg2d.comment: computed as the iceberg melt water  flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

fsitherm.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
fsitherm.long_name: Water Flux into Sea Water due to Sea Ice Thermodynamics
fsitherm.comment: computed as the sea ice thermodynamic water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

wfo.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
wfo.comment: computed as the water  flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.  This is the sum of the next two variables in this table.

wfonocorr.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
wfonocorr.long_name: Water Flux into Sea Water Without Flux Correction
wfonocorr.comment: computed as the water  flux (without flux correction) into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

vsfpr.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
vsfpr.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water due to Rainfall

vsfevap.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
vsfevap.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water due to Evaporation

vsfriver.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
vsfriver.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water From Rivers

vsfsit.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
vsfsit.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water due to Sea Ice Thermodynamics
vsfsit.comment: This variable measures the virtual salt flux into sea water due to the melting of sea ice. It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.

vsf.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
vsf.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water

sfdsi.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
sfdsi.long_name: Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux
sfdsi.comment: This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.

sfriver.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
sfriver.long_name: Salt Flux into Sea Water from Rivers

hfgeou.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
hfgeou.long_name: Upward Geothermal Heat Flux at Sea Floor

hfrainds.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea
hfrainds.long_name: Temperature Flux due to Rainfall Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water
hfrainds.comment: This is defined as ""where ice_free_sea over sea""; i.e., the total flux (considered here) entering the ice-free portion of the grid cell divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

hfevapds.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea
hfevapds.long_name: Temperature Flux due to Evaporation Expressed as Heat Flux Out of Sea Water
hfevapds.comment: "This is defined as ""where ice_free_sea over sea"""

hfrunoffds.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
hfrunoffds.long_name: Temperature Flux due to Runoff Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water

hfrunoffds2d.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
hfrunoffds2d.long_name: Temperature Flux due to Runoff Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water

hfsnthermds.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
hfsnthermds.long_name: Heat Flux into Sea Water due to Snow Thermodynamics

hfsnthermds2d.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
hfsnthermds2d.long_name: Heat Flux into Sea Water due to Snow Thermodynamics

hfsifrazil.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
hfsifrazil.long_name: Heat Flux into Sea Water due to Frazil Ice Formation

hfsifrazil2d.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
hfsifrazil2d.long_name: Heat Flux into Sea Water due to Frazil Ice Formation

hfsithermds.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
hfsithermds.long_name: Heat Flux into Sea Water due to Sea Ice Thermodynamics

hfsithermds2d.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
hfsithermds2d.long_name: Heat Flux into Sea Water due to Sea Ice Thermodynamics

hfibthermds.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
hfibthermds.long_name: Heat Flux into Sea Water due to Iceberg Thermodynamics

hfibthermds2d.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
hfibthermds2d.long_name: Heat Flux into Sea Water due to Iceberg Thermodynamics

rlds.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea
rlds.comment: "This is defined as ""where ice_free_sea over sea"""

hfls.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea
hfls.comment: "This is defined as ""where ice_free_sea over sea"""

hfss.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea
hfss.comment: "This is defined as ""where ice_free_sea over sea"""

rsntds.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
rsntds.long_name: Net Downward Shortwave Radiation at Sea Water Surface
rsntds.comment: This is the flux into the surface of liquid sea water only. This excludes shortwave flux absorbed by sea ice, but includes any light that passes through the ice and is absorbed by the ocean.

rsds.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
rsds.long_name: Downwelling Shortwave Radiation in Sea Water

hfds.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
hfds.long_name: Downward Heat Flux at Sea Water Surface
hfds.comment: "This is the net flux of heat entering the liquid water column through its upper surface (excluding any ""flux adjustment"") ."

zfull.cell_methods: time: mean area: mean where sea
zfull.long_name: Depth Below Geoid of Ocean Layer
